displaytitle: Descent from the Cross by Torchlight
dimensions: sheet trimmed to plate: 21 x 16.3 cm. (8 1/4 x 6 7/16 in.)
creditline: Gift of David H. McAlpin, Class of 1920, and Mrs. McAlpin, in memory of Professor Clifton R. Hall
catalograisonne: Bartsch 83; Biörklund and Barnard 54; Hind 280; Hollstein 46; Münz 232; New Hollstein 245.286

titles.title: Descent from the Cross by Torchlight

makers.displaydate: 1606–1669; born Leiden, Netherlands; died Amsterdam, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Rembrandt van Rijn, 1606–1669; born Leiden, Netherlands; died Amsterdam, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Darkness—rendered with a dense network of etched lines—descends like a thick curtain in Rembrandt’s nocturnal staging of the moment—mentioned only briefly in biblical accounts—when Jesus’s body was taken down from the cross by his followers Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus. Only one light source—a torch held above Christ’s right foot, still attached to the cross—fitfully illuminates the complex chain of action, which includes a spectral hand reaching up out of the shadows to offer assistance.
